intro: Psychrophila leptosepala, commonly known as the Antarctic hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the extreme environments of Antarctica. It is a small, low-growing grass that thrives in the cold, arid conditions of the continent. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are adapted to minimize water loss in its harsh habitat. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or brown in color. Psychrophila leptosepala plays a role in the fragile ecosystems of Antarctica, contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for microorganisms.
